```{python}
#| label: daily-deaths-breakdown-column-chart
#| fig-cap: "The Daily Toll: A breakdown of the 150,000 deaths occurring every day, highlighting the immense scale of preventable deaths from disease."

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np
from pathlib import Path

# Find project root dynamically
project_root = Path.cwd()
if project_root.name != 'decentralized-institutes-of-health':
    while project_root.name != 'decentralized-institutes-of-health' and project_root.parent != project_root:
        project_root = project_root.parent

# Import chart styles
import sys
sys.path.append(str(project_root))
from brain.figures._chart_style import setup_chart_style, add_watermark, clean_spines
from brain.figures._chart_style import COLOR_BLACK, COLOR_WHITE

# Apply chart styles
setup_chart_style()

# Data
categories = ['Total Daily\nDeaths', 'From\nDisease', 'Preventable\nDeaths', 'Child\nDeaths']
values = [150000, 130000, 80000, 14300]
colors = [COLOR_WHITE, COLOR_WHITE, COLOR_BLACK, COLOR_WHITE]

# Create figure and axes
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 7))

# Create bars
bars = ax.bar(categories, values, color=colors, edgecolor=COLOR_BLACK, linewidth=1.5, zorder=2)

# Set title
ax.set_title('The Daily Toll: Humanity\'s Silent Catastrophe', fontsize=28, weight='bold', pad=30)

# Remove Y-axis as we will label bars directly
ax.get_yaxis().set_visible(False)

# Clean up spines
clean_spines(ax, positions=['top', 'right', 'left'])

# Set x-axis tick parameters
ax.tick_params(axis='x', which='major', labelsize=14, length=0, pad=10)

# Set Y-axis limits to provide space for labels
ax.set_ylim(0, max(values) * 1.2)

# Add data labels
for i, bar in enumerate(bars):
    height = bar.get_height()
    label_text = f'{height:,.0f}'
    
    # Use white text for the black bar, black text for white bars
    text_color = COLOR_WHITE if colors[i] == COLOR_BLACK else COLOR_BLACK
    
    # Place label inside the bar
    v_offset = -15
    va = 'top'
    
    ax.annotate(
        label_text,
        xy=(bar.get_x() + bar.get_width() / 2, height),
        xytext=(0, v_offset),
        textcoords="offset points",
        ha='center', va=va,
        fontsize=24, 
        fontweight='bold',
        color=text_color,
        fontfamily='Courier New'
    )

# Add watermark
add_watermark(fig)

# Save the figure
output_dir = project_root / 'brain' / 'figures'
output_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
output_path = output_dir / 'daily-deaths-breakdown-column-chart.png'

# Save the figure
plt.savefig(output_path, dpi=200, bbox_inches=None, facecolor=COLOR_WHITE)

# Add metadata for attribution
add_png_metadata(output_path, title="Daily Deaths Breakdown Column Chart")

# Show plot
plt.show()

```
